testcase.brief: Port forwarding for tcp&udp (ssh, ftp, telnet,tftp….)
testcase.description:
Topology to use Topo4 Description Port forwarding for tcp&udp (ssh, ftp, telnet,tftp….) Platform Dependence BR100,BR200,BRAP330,BRAP350 Pre-condition 1. Wan interface eth0 get ip on br 2. Nat enable on wan interface 3. Pc1 connect to br lan interface and get lan subnet ip address 4. Enable ftp server on pc1 5. BR100 connect to br lan interface and get lan subnet ip address 6. Enable telnet server on br100 7. Pc2 connect to external network on br and pc2 can reach br wan interface Test procedure 1. Configure 1 port forwarding nat policy for ftp tcp on br ip nat-policy ftp type virtual-host inside-host 192.168.1.11 inside-port 21 outside-port 2001 protocol tcp 2. Configure 1 port forwarding nat policy for tftp udp on br ip nat-policy tftp type virtual-host inside-host 192.168.1.10 inside-port 69 outside-port 2009 protocol udp 3. apply the port forwarding nat policy on wan interface interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy ftp 4. interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy tftp 5. pc2 send tcp port 2001 connection to eth0 ip address of br, check result1 6. pc2 send udp port 2009 connection to eth0 ip address of br, check result2 7. no the ftp port forwarding on wan interface eth0 , check result 3 no interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy ftp
8. pc2 send tcp port 2001 connection to eth0 ip address of br, again, check result 4 9. pc2 send udp port 2009 connection to eth0 ip address of br, again check result2 10. no the tftp port forwarding on wan interface eth0 , check result5 no interface eth0 mode wan nat-policy tftp 11. pc2 send udp port 2009 connection to eth0 ip address of br, again check result6 Expect result 1. pc2 connect to pc1 ftp server and can upload and download file through ftp connection 2. pc2 connect to pc1 tftp server and can upload and down load file 3. the ftp connection is disconnected on pc2 and the tftp is still online. --?the ftp connection can’t be disconnected on the step
4. pc2 can’t connect to pc1 ftp server and can’t upload and download file through ftp connection 5. the tftp connection is disconnected on pc2 6. pc2 can’t connect to pc1 tftp server

step.desc: configure mgt0.1 with dhcp service enable
step.telnet: -v "interface mgt0.1 vlan ${br1.vlan1}" -v "interface mgt0.1 ip ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}/${br.lan.netmask}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server ip-pool ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_start} ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip_pool_end}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options netmask 255.255.255.0" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options default-gateway ${br1.br.mgt0.1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server options dns1 ${pub.dns1.ip}" -v "interface mgt0.1 dhcp-server enable"

-v "user-profile auto1" -v "user-profile auto1 vlan-id ${br1.vlan1} attribute 1" -v "security-object lan1" -v "security-object lan1 default-user-profile-attr 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} mode bridge-access user-profile-attribute 1" -v "interface ${br1.br.lan.int1} security-object lan1" -v "int ${br1.br.lan.int1} mac-learning enable"

step.desc: set br1.vpc1.tif.ip var for vpc1 on BR side
1. Configure 2 port forwarding nat policy for tcp and udp (ftp and tftp)on br and bind the 2 nat-policy on the wan interface
step.telnet: -v "ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_1 type virtual-host inside-host ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} inside-port 21 outside-port 4000 protocol tcp" -v "ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_2 type virtual-host inside-host ${br1.vpc1.tif.ip} inside-port 69 outside-port 4100 protocol udp" -v "interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}_1" -v "interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}_2"

-v "sh ip nat-policy" -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_1" -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_2" -v "_ff id 1 dst-ip ${br1.br.wan.ip} dst-port 4000 bidirectional" -v "_ff id 2 dst-ip ${br1.br.wan.ip} dst-port 4100 bidirectional" -v "_kdebug fe basic" -v "_kdebug fe detail"

step.desc: pc2 send udp port 4100 connection to eth0 ip address of br,tftp should be successful；pc2 send tcpport 4000 connection to eth0 ip address of br,ftp should be successful
step.ssh: -v "echo \"test auto${job.id}\" > auto${job.id}.file" -v "tftp ${br1.br.wan.ip} 4100 -c put auto${job.id}.file" -v "curl ftp://${br1.vpc1.user}:${br1.vpc1.passwd}@${br1.br.wan.ip}:4000 -# -T auto${job.id}.file" -v "rm -f auto${job.id}.file"

step.desc: check the file on vpc1，the file is tftp send to br.vpc1 from external pc
no the port forwarding on wan interface eth0 about ftp
step.telnet: -v "no interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}_1" -v "sh ip nat-policy" -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_1" -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_2"

step.desc: pc2 send tftp and ftp connection to eth0 ip address of br，tftp is successfully but ftp is failed
step.ssh: -v "echo \"test tftp\" > auto${job.id}.file" -v "tftp ${br1.br.wan.ip} 4100 -c put auto${job.id}.file" -v "curl ftp://${br1.vpc1.user}:${br1.vpc1.passwd}@${br1.br.wan.ip}:4000 -# -T auto${job.id}.file" -v "rm -f auto${job.id}.file"

step.desc: no the port forwarding on wan interface eth0 about tftp
step.telnet: -v "no interface ${br1.br.wan.int1} mode wan nat-policy auto${job.id}_2" -v "sh ip nat-policy" -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_1" -v "show ip nat-policy auto${job.id}_2"

step.desc: pc2 send tftp and ftp connection to eth0 ip address of br，ftp and tftp both failed
step.ssh: -v "echo \"test tftp\" > auto${job.id}.file" -v "tftp ${br1.br.wan.ip} 4100 -c put auto${job.id}.file" -v "curl ftp://${br1.vpc1.user}:${br1.vpc1.passwd}@${br1.br.wan.ip}:4000 -# -T auto${job.id}.file" -v "rm -f auto${job.id}.file"
